column4: Would someone like to help me out with a sound problem? i think i am just missing a group and need help to find out the default groups i need
could someone just run "groups" for their main user and tell me what they have??
how are you suppose to add groups to your user name correctly?
addgroup
as root right?
yeah
you should have maple10/bin/maple  (or at least this is how maple 9.5 does it)
you can double click on that, or run it in a terminal
ok, type '/home/scott/maple10/bin/maple' in a terminal and tell me the output
if it is long, use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
oh right, you want xmaple, not maple :)
you may have some maple's running in the background now that you can't see... feel free to kill them
don't you have it in that same folder?
np, you can create a launcher for it in your menu now
right click on the ubuntu icon by your menu and hit "edit menu", then add a new item and the command to run is '/home/scott/maple10/bin/xmaple'
use hardy
ok how can i completely downgrade after i've already upgraded to ibex?
reinstall
you mean like from a cd?
yes.  Downgrading is not supported, so you need to reinstall if you want to use hardy
IndyGunFreak: am i correct in thinking that the only way to get compiz working in ibex with an ati card is to...not use ibex, but downgrade to hardy?
don't know, don't use ati
